return.description: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.

notes.description:
Variables that have a dependency on the connection identifier,
    such as statement identifiers returned
    by oci_parse, must also be freed before the
    underlying database connection is closed.

Prior to version PHP 5.1.2 (PECL OCI8
    1.1) oci_close was a no-op. In more recent
    versions it correctly closes the Oracle
    connection. Use oci8.old_oci_close_semantics
    option to restore old behavior of this function.

The oci_close function does not close the
    underlying database connections created
    with oci_pconnect.

In PHP versions before 5.0.0 you must
    use ocilogoff instead. The old function name can still be used
in current versions, however it is deprecated and not recommended.
